reviewText: I loved the whole series. If your kid wrestles, buy this.
More of a philosophy than a technical guide. . .not bad, but not a how to guide for the young wrestler. . .

A review of the essential movements leading to pinning situations. Arm control is presented, but the use of legs is particularly stressed. Both the Jam and Flow, then the Jam and Control chapters present jamming action through ankle grabbing and leg attack; ankle hooking; leg in, tight waist, and chop attacks. Then follow hip, switch, and circle drills.
The two start positions are briefly presented, and the Finish chapter's biggest example is the craddle finish, formerly presented in the Jam and Control chapter.
